intro: Sonzaya australiana, commonly known as the Australian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and has a woody base with hairy stems. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture. Sonzaya australiana is adapted to sandy soils and can tolerate salt spray, making it a hardy coastal plant.
